EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5); transport belt connection routes mining output.
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5). (Recently, the copper furnace was used to smelt 20 copper ore, yielding 4 copper plates.)
• Common Input Chest – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection linking mining output to the feeder inserter.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore.
• Sink Chest – Wooden Chest at (-11.5, -46.5) serving as temporary ore storage.
• Sink Inserter – Burner Inserter at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5).
• Transport Belt Connection linking mining drill drop to sink inserter pickup.

### Automation Research Lab at position (5.5, 5.5)
Consists of:
• Lab placed at (5.5, 5.5) to conduct Automation technology research by consuming automation science packs (10 inserted; additional packs required).
• Small Electric Pole at (5.5, 3.5) positioned adjacent to the lab to provide a power connection.
Note: Although a steam engine was later crafted, its placement failed—leaving the power network dependent solely on the pole and the lab, with power remaining incomplete.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement Range and Buildability:
 – Always move close to the target placement location and use the nearest_buildable function to ensure the area is valid.
• Undefined Variables and Nil References:
 – Initialize all temporary variables and entity references properly to avoid nil indexing.
• Occupied Tile Conflicts & Spacing Issues:
 – Verify that target tiles are unoccupied and have sufficient spacing before attempting to place an entity.
• Object Attribute and Method Misuse:
 – Access non-callable properties (such as a buildable_area’s center) correctly without invoking them as functions.
• Inventory, Crafting, and Ingredient Requirements:
 – Confirm that required items and sub-ingredients (for example, copper-plate, copper-cable, and electronic-circuit for lab crafting) are available before initiating complex recipes.
 – Check that sufficient ingredients (such as the needed iron-plates for steam engine crafting) are present to prevent crafting failures.
 – Validate inventory for the required entity prior to placement to avoid errors like “No lab in inventory” or “No steam_engine in inventory.”
• Belt Connection Targeting:
 – Ensure transport belt connections follow the correct sequence and intermediary placements when linking entities.
• Power Connection Components:
 – Verify that all necessary power supply components (such as power poles and energy sources) are present and correctly connected before initiating a power network.
• Fuel Shortages:
 – Monitor and replenish fuel levels on entities (e.g., burner inserters) to sustain continuous operation.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly.  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized.

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement.  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement.  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access can trigger errors.

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype adjacent to a reference position based on the specified direction and spacing.  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity.  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied or invalid.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position.
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted transport belt connection target.
